intro: Anil cardiophylla, commonly known as the heartleaf anil, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
